metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3520 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
There's a flaw in lz4. An attacker who submits a crafted file to an application linked with lz4 may be able to trigger an integer overflow, leading to calling of memmove() on a negative size argument, causing an out-of-bounds write and/or a crash. The greatest impact of this flaw is to availability, with some potential impact to confidentiality and integrity as well.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3520` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

liblz4-1 - 0.0~r131-2ubuntu3.1
liblz4-tool - 0.0~r131-2ubuntu3.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: lz4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.0~r131-2ubuntu3.1').
